    ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoTooltip       = 1 << 6,   //              // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: disable tooltip when hovering the preview.

    


    

    
1715

    
    

    
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoLabel         = 1 << 7,   //              // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: disable display of inline text label (the label is still forwarded to the tooltip and picker).

    


    

    
1716

    
    

    
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview   = 1 << 8,   //              // ColorPicker: disable bigger color preview on right side of the picker, use small color square preview instead.

    


    

    
1717

    
    

    
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoDragDrop      = 1 << 9,   //              // ColorEdit: disable drag and drop target. ColorButton: disable drag and drop source.

    


    

    
1718

    
    

    
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoBorder        = 1 << 10,  //              // ColorButton: disable border (which is enforced by default)

    


    

    
1719

    
    

    

    


    

    
1720

    
    

    
    // User Options (right-click on widget to change some of them).

    


    

    
1721

    
    

    
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaBar        = 1 << 16,  //              // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: show vertical alpha bar/gradient in picker.

    


    

    
1722

    
    

    
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreview    = 1 << 17,  //              // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: display preview as a transparent color over a checkerboard, instead of opaque.

    


    

    
1723

    
    

    
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf= 1 << 18,  //              // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: display half opaque / half checkerboard, instead of opaque.

    


    

    
1724

    
    

    
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_HDR             = 1 << 19,  //              // (WIP) ColorEdit: Currently only disable 0.0f..1.0f limits in RGBA edition (note: you probably want to use ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float flag as well).

    


    

    
1725

    
    

    
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB      = 1 << 20,  // [Display]    // ColorEdit: override _display_ type among RGB/HSV/Hex. ColorPicker: select any combination using one or more of RGB/HSV/Hex.

    


    

    
1726

    
    

    
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV      = 1 << 21,  // [Display]    // "

    


    

    
1727

    
    

    
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex      = 1 << 22,  // [Display]    // "

    


    

    
1728

    
    

    
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_Uint8           = 1 << 23,  // [DataType]   // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: _display_ values formatted as 0..255.

    


    

    
1729

    
    

    
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float           = 1 << 24,  // [DataType]   // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: _display_ values formatted as 0.0f..1.0f floats instead of 0..255 integers. No round-trip of value via integers.

    


    

    
1730

    
    

    
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar    = 1 << 25,  // [Picker]     // ColorPicker: bar for Hue, rectangle for Sat/Value.

    


    

    
1731

    
    

    
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel  = 1 << 26,  // [Picker]     // ColorPicker: wheel for Hue, triangle for Sat/Value.

    


    

    
1732

    
    

    
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB        = 1 << 27,  // [Input]      // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: input and output data in RGB format.

    


    

    
1733

    
    

    
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV        = 1 << 28,  // [Input]      // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: input and output data in HSV format.

    


    

    
1734

    
    

    

    


    

    
1735

    
    

    
    // Defaults Options. You can set application defaults using SetColorEditOptions(). The intent is that you probably don't want to

    


    

    
1736

    
    

    
    // override them in most of your calls. Let the user choose via the option menu and/or call SetColorEditOptions() once during startup.

    


    

    
1737

    
    

    
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_DefaultOptions_ = ImGuiColorEditFlags_Uint8 | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB | ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB | ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar,

    


    

    
1738

    
    

    

    


    

    
1739

    
    

    
    // [Internal] Masks

    


    

    
1740

    
    

    
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_    = ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex,

    


    

    
1741

    
    

    
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_   = ImGuiColorEditFlags_Uint8 | ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float,

    


    

    
1742

    
    

    
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_     = ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel | ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar,

    


    

    
1743

    
    

    
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_      = ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB | ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV,

    


    

    
1744

    
    

    

    


    

    
1745

    
    

    
    // Obsolete names (will be removed)

    


    

    
1746

    
    

    
    // ImGuiColorEditFlags_RGB = ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB, ImGuiColorEditFlags_HSV = ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV, ImGuiColorEditFlags_HEX = ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex  // [renamed in 1.69]

    


    

    
1747

    
    

    
};

    


    

    
1748

    
    

    

    


    

    
1749

    
    

    
// Flags for DragFloat(), DragInt(), SliderFloat(), SliderInt() etc.

    


    

    
1750

    
    

    
// We use the same sets of flags for DragXXX() and SliderXXX() functions as the features are the same and it makes it easier to swap them.

    


    

    
1751

    
    

    
// (Those are per-item flags. There are shared flags in ImGuiIO: io.ConfigDragClickToInputText)

    


    

    
1752

    
    

    
enum ImGuiSliderFlags_

    


    

    
1753

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
1754

    
    

    
    ImGuiSliderFlags_None                   = 0,

    


    

    
1755

    
    

    
    ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp            = 1 << 4,       // Clamp value to min/max bounds when input manually with CTRL+Click. By default CTRL+Click allows going out of bounds.

    


    

    
1756

    
    

    
    ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic            = 1 << 5,       // Make the widget logarithmic (linear otherwise). Consider using ImGuiSliderFlags_NoRoundToFormat with this if using a format-string with small amount of digits.

    


    

    
1757

    
    

    
    ImGuiSliderFlags_NoRoundToFormat        = 1 << 6,       // Disable rounding underlying value to match precision of the display format string (e.g. %.3f values are rounded to those 3 digits)

    


    

    
1758

    
    

    
    ImGuiSliderFlags_NoInput                = 1 << 7,       // Disable CTRL+Click or Enter key allowing to input text directly into the widget

    


    

    
1759

    
    

    
    ImGuiSliderFlags_InvalidMask_           = 0x7000000F,   // [Internal] We treat using those bits as being potentially a 'float power' argument from the previous API that has got miscast to this enum, and will trigger an assert if needed.

    


    

    
1760

    
    

    

    


    

    
1761

    
    

    
    // Obsolete names (will be removed)

    


    

    
1762

    
    

    
#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS

    


    

    
1763

    
    

    
    ImGuiSliderFlags_ClampOnInput = ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp, // [renamed in 1.79]

    


    

    
1764

    
    

    
#endif

    


    

    
1765

    
    

    
};

    


    

    
1766

    
    

    

    


    

    
1767

    
    

    
// Identify a mouse button.

    


    

    
1768

    
    

    
// Those values are guaranteed to be stable and we frequently use 0/1 directly. Named enums provided for convenience.

    


    

    
1769

    
    

    
enum ImGuiMouseButton_

    


    

    
1770

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
1771

    
    

    
    ImGuiMouseButton_Left = 0,

    


    

    
1772

    
    

    
    ImGuiMouseButton_Right = 1,

    


    

    
1773

    
    

    
    ImGuiMouseButton_Middle = 2,

    


    

    
1774

    
    

    
    ImGuiMouseButton_COUNT = 5

    


    

    
1775

    
    

    
};

    


    

    
1776

    
    

    

    


    

    
1777

    
    

    
// Enumeration for GetMouseCursor()

    


    

    
1778

    
    

    
// User code may request backend to display given cursor by calling SetMouseCursor(), which is why we have some cursors that are marked unused here

    


    

    
1779

    
    

    
enum ImGuiMouseCursor_

    


    

    
1780

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
1781

    
    

    
    ImGuiMouseCursor_None = -1,

    


    

    
1782

    
    

    
    ImGuiMouseCursor_Arrow = 0,

    


    

    
1783

    
    

    
    ImGuiMouseCursor_TextInput,         // When hovering over InputText, etc.

    


    

    
1784

    
    

    
    ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeAll,         // (Unused by Dear ImGui functions)

    


    

    
1785

    
    

    
    ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNS,          // When hovering over a horizontal border

    


    

    
1786

    
    

    
    ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeEW,          // When hovering over a vertical border or a column

    


    

    
1787

    
    

    
    ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNESW,        // When hovering over the bottom-left corner of a window

    


    

    
1788

    
    

    
    ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNWSE,        // When hovering over the bottom-right corner of a window

    


    

    
1789

    
    

    
    ImGuiMouseCursor_Hand,              // (Unused by Dear ImGui functions. Use for e.g. hyperlinks)

    


    

    
1790

    
    

    
    ImGuiMouseCursor_NotAllowed,        // When hovering something with disallowed interaction. Usually a crossed circle.

    


    

    
1791

    
    

    
    ImGuiMouseCursor_COUNT

    


    

    
1792

    
    

    
};

    


    

    
1793

    
    

    

    


    

    
1794

    
    

    
// Enumeration for ImGui::SetWindow***(), SetNextWindow***(), SetNextItem***() functions

    


    

    
1795

    
    

    
// Represent a condition.

    


    

    
1796

    
    

    
// Important: Treat as a regular enum! Do NOT combine multiple values using binary operators! All the functions above treat 0 as a shortcut to ImGuiCond_Always.

    


    

    
1797

    
    

    
enum ImGuiCond_

    


    

    
1798

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
1799

    
    

    
    ImGuiCond_None          = 0,        // No condition (always set the variable), same as _Always

    


    

    
1800

    
    

    
    ImGuiCond_Always        = 1 << 0,   // No condition (always set the variable), same as _None

    


    

    
1801

    
    

    
    ImGuiCond_Once          = 1 << 1,   // Set the variable once per runtime session (only the first call will succeed)

    


    

    
1802

    
    

    
    ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver  = 1 << 2,   // Set the variable if the object/window has no persistently saved data (no entry in .ini file)

    


    

    
1803

    
    

    
    ImGuiCond_Appearing     = 1 << 3,   // Set the variable if the object/window is appearing after being hidden/inactive (or the first time)

    


    

    
1804

    
    

    
};

    


    

    
1805

    
    

    

    


    

    
1806

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
1807

    
    

    
// [SECTION] Helpers: Memory allocations macros, ImVector<>

    


    

    
1808

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
1809

    
    

    

    


    

    
1810

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
1811

    
    

    
// IM_MALLOC(), IM_FREE(), IM_NEW(), IM_PLACEMENT_NEW(), IM_DELETE()

    


    

    
1812

    
    

    
// We call C++ constructor on own allocated memory via the placement "new(ptr) Type()" syntax.

    


    

    
1813

    
    

    
// Defining a custom placement new() with a custom parameter allows us to bypass including <new> which on some platforms complains when user has disabled exceptions.

    


    

    
1814

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
1815

    
    

    

    


    

    
1816

    
    

    
struct ImNewWrapper {};

    


    

    
1817

    
    

    
inline void* operator new(size_t, ImNewWrapper, void* ptr) { return ptr; }

    


    

    
1818

    
    

    
inline void  operator delete(void*, ImNewWrapper, void*)   {} // This is only required so we can use the symmetrical new()

    


    

    
1819

    
    

    
#define IM_ALLOC(_SIZE)                     ImGui::MemAlloc(_SIZE)

    


    

    
1820

    
    

    
#define IM_FREE(_PTR)                       ImGui::MemFree(_PTR)

    


    

    
1821

    
    

    
#define IM_PLACEMENT_NEW(_PTR)              new(ImNewWrapper(), _PTR)

    


    

    
1822

    
    

    
#define IM_NEW(_TYPE)                       new(ImNewWrapper(), ImGui::MemAlloc(sizeof(_TYPE))) _TYPE

    


    

    
1823

    
    

    
template<typename T> void IM_DELETE(T* p)   { if (p) { p->~T(); ImGui::MemFree(p); } }

    


    

    
1824

    
    

    

    


    

    
1825

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
1826

    
    

    
// ImVector<>

    


    

    
1827

    
    

    
// Lightweight std::vector<>-like class to avoid dragging dependencies (also, some implementations of STL with debug enabled are absurdly slow, we bypass it so our code runs fast in debug).

    


    

    
1828

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
1829

    
    

    
// - You generally do NOT need to care or use this ever. But we need to make it available in imgui.h because some of our public structures are relying on it.

    


    

    
1830

    
    

    
// - We use std-like naming convention here, which is a little unusual for this codebase.

    


    

    
1831

    
    

    
// - Important: clear() frees memory, resize(0) keep the allocated buffer. We use resize(0) a lot to intentionally recycle allocated buffers across frames and amortize our costs.

    


    

    
1832

    
    

    
// - Important: our implementation does NOT call C++ constructors/destructors, we treat everything as raw data! This is intentional but be extra mindful of that,

    


    

    
1833

    
    

    
//   Do NOT use this class as a std::vector replacement in your own code! Many of the structures used by dear imgui can be safely initialized by a zero-memset.

    


    

    
1834

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
1835

    
    

    

    


    

    
1836

    
    

    
IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_OFF

    


    

    
1837

    
    

    
template<typename T>

    


    

    
1838

    
    

    
struct ImVector

    


    

    
1839

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
1840

    
    

    
    int                 Size;

    


    

    
1841

    
    

    
    int                 Capacity;

    


    

    
1842

    
    

    
    T*                  Data;

    


    

    
1843

    
    

    

    


    

    
1844

    
    

    
    // Provide standard typedefs but we don't use them ourselves.

    


    

    
1845

    
    

    
    typedef T                   value_type;

    


    

    
1846

    
    

    
    typedef value_type*         iterator;

    


    

    
1847

    
    

    
    typedef const value_type*   const_iterator;

    


    

    
1848

    
    

    

    


    

    
1849

    
    

    
    // Constructors, destructor

    


    

    
1850

    
    

    
    inline ImVector()                                       { Size = Capacity = 0; Data = NULL; }

    


    

    
1851

    
    

    
    inline ImVector(const ImVector<T>& src)                 { Size = Capacity = 0; Data = NULL; operator=(src); }

    


    

    
1852

    
    

    
    inline ImVector<T>& operator=(const ImVector<T>& src)   { clear(); resize(src.Size); if (src.Data) memcpy(Data, src.Data, (size_t)Size * sizeof(T)); return *this; }

    


    

    
1853

    
    

    
    inline ~ImVector()                                      { if (Data) IM_FREE(Data); } // Important: does not destruct anything

    


    

    
1854

    
    

    

    


    

    
1855

    
    

    
    inline void         clear()                             { if (Data) { Size = Capacity = 0; IM_FREE(Data); Data = NULL; } }  // Important: does not destruct anything

    


    

    
1856

    
    

    
    inline void         clear_delete()                      { for (int n = 0; n < Size; n++) IM_DELETE(Data[n]); clear(); }     // Important: never called automatically! always explicit.

    


    

    
1857

    
    

    
    inline void         clear_destruct()                    { for (int n = 0; n < Size; n++) Data[n].~T(); clear(); }           // Important: never called automatically! always explicit.

    


    

    
1858

    
    

    

    


    

    
1859

    
    

    
    inline bool         empty() const                       { return Size == 0; }

    


    

    
1860

    
    

    
    inline int          size() const                        { return Size; }

    


    

    
1861

    
    

    
    inline int          size_in_bytes() const               { return Size * (int)sizeof(T); }

    


    

    
1862

    
    

    
    inline int          max_size() const                    { return 0x7FFFFFFF / (int)sizeof(T); }

    


    

    
1863

    
    

    
    inline int          capacity() const                    { return Capacity; }

    


    

    
1864

    
    

    
    inline T&           operator[](int i)                   { IM_ASSERT(i >= 0 && i < Size); return Data[i]; }

    


    

    
1865

    
    

    
    inline const T&     operator[](int i) const             { IM_ASSERT(i >= 0 && i < Size); return Data[i]; }

    


    

    
1866

    
    

    

    


    

    
1867

    
    

    
    inline T*           begin()                             { return Data; }

    


    

    
1868

    
    

    
    inline const T*     begin() const                       { return Data; }

    


    

    
1869

    
    

    
    inline T*           end()                               { return Data + Size; }

    


    

    
1870

    
    

    
    inline const T*     end() const                         { return Data + Size; }

    


    

    
1871

    
    

    
    inline T&           front()                             { IM_ASSERT(Size > 0); return Data[0]; }

    


    

    
1872

    
    

    
    inline const T&     front() const                       { IM_ASSERT(Size > 0); return Data[0]; }

    


    

    
1873

    
    

    
    inline T&           back()                              { IM_ASSERT(Size > 0); return Data[Size - 1]; }

    


    

    
1874

    
    

    
    inline const T&     back() const                        { IM_ASSERT(Size > 0); return Data[Size - 1]; }

    


    

    
1875

    
    

    
    inline void         swap(ImVector<T>& rhs)              { int rhs_size = rhs.Size; rhs.Size = Size; Size = rhs_size; int rhs_cap = rhs.Capacity; rhs.Capacity = Capacity; Capacity = rhs_cap; T* rhs_data = rhs.Data; rhs.Data = Data; Data = rhs_data; }

    


    

    
1876

    
    

    

    


    

    
1877

    
    

    
    inline int          _grow_capacity(int sz) const        { int new_capacity = Capacity ? (Capacity + Capacity / 2) : 8; return new_capacity > sz ? new_capacity : sz; }

    


    

    
1878

    
    

    
    inline void         resize(int new_size)                { if (new_size > Capacity) reserve(_grow_capacity(new_size)); Size = new_size; }

    


    

    
1879

    
    

    
    inline void         resize(int new_size, const T& v)    { if (new_size > Capacity) reserve(_grow_capacity(new_size)); if (new_size > Size) for (int n = Size; n < new_size; n++) memcpy(&Data[n], &v, sizeof(v)); Size = new_size; }

    


    

    
1880

    
    

    
    inline void         shrink(int new_size)                { IM_ASSERT(new_size <= Size); Size = new_size; } // Resize a vector to a smaller size, guaranteed not to cause a reallocation

    


    

    
1881

    
    

    
    inline void         reserve(int new_capacity)           { if (new_capacity <= Capacity) return; T* new_data = (T*)IM_ALLOC((size_t)new_capacity * sizeof(T)); if (Data) { memcpy(new_data, Data, (size_t)Size * sizeof(T)); IM_FREE(Data); } Data = new_data; Capacity = new_capacity; }

    


    

    
1882

    
    

    
    inline void         reserve_discard(int new_capacity)   { if (new_capacity <= Capacity) return; if (Data) IM_FREE(Data); Data = (T*)IM_ALLOC((size_t)new_capacity * sizeof(T)); Capacity = new_capacity; }

    


    

    
1883

    
    

    

    


    

    
1884

    
    

    
    // NB: It is illegal to call push_back/push_front/insert with a reference pointing inside the ImVector data itself! e.g. v.push_back(v[10]) is forbidden.

    


    

    
1885

    
    

    
    inline void         push_back(const T& v)               { if (Size == Capacity) reserve(_grow_capacity(Size + 1)); memcpy(&Data[Size], &v, sizeof(v)); Size++; }

    


    

    
1886

    
    

    
    inline void         pop_back()                          { IM_ASSERT(Size > 0); Size--; }

    


    

    
1887

    
    

    
    inline void         push_front(const T& v)              { if (Size == 0) push_back(v); else insert(Data, v); }

    


    

    
1888

    
    

    
    inline T*           erase(const T* it)                  { IM_ASSERT(it >= Data && it < Data + Size); const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data; memmove(Data + off, Data + off + 1, ((size_t)Size - (size_t)off - 1) * sizeof(T)); Size--; return Data + off; }

    


    

    
1889

    
    

    
    inline T*           erase(const T* it, const T* it_last){ IM_ASSERT(it >= Data && it < Data + Size && it_last >= it && it_last <= Data + Size); const ptrdiff_t count = it_last - it; const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data; memmove(Data + off, Data + off + count, ((size_t)Size - (size_t)off - (size_t)count) * sizeof(T)); Size -= (int)count; return Data + off; }

    


    

    
1890

    
    

    
    inline T*           erase_unsorted(const T* it)         { IM_ASSERT(it >= Data && it < Data + Size);  const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data; if (it < Data + Size - 1) memcpy(Data + off, Data + Size - 1, sizeof(T)); Size--; return Data + off; }

    


    

    
1891

    
    

    
    inline T*           insert(const T* it, const T& v)     { IM_ASSERT(it >= Data && it <= Data + Size); const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data; if (Size == Capacity) reserve(_grow_capacity(Size + 1)); if (off < (int)Size) memmove(Data + off + 1, Data + off, ((size_t)Size - (size_t)off) * sizeof(T)); memcpy(&Data[off], &v, sizeof(v)); Size++; return Data + off; }

    


    

    
1892

    
    

    
    inline bool         contains(const T& v) const          { const T* data = Data;  const T* data_end = Data + Size; while (data < data_end) if (*data++ == v) return true; return false; }

    


    

    
1893

    
    

    
    inline T*           find(const T& v)                    { T* data = Data;  const T* data_end = Data + Size; while (data < data_end) if (*data == v) break; else ++data; return data; }

    


    

    
1894

    
    

    
    inline const T*     find(const T& v) const              { const T* data = Data;  const T* data_end = Data + Size; while (data < data_end) if (*data == v) break; else ++data; return data; }

    


    

    
1895

    
    

    
    inline bool         find_erase(const T& v)              { const T* it = find(v); if (it < Data + Size) { erase(it); return true; } return false; }

    


    

    
1896

    
    

    
    inline bool         find_erase_unsorted(const T& v)     { const T* it = find(v); if (it < Data + Size) { erase_unsorted(it); return true; } return false; }

    


    

    
1897

    
    

    
    inline int          index_from_ptr(const T* it) const   { IM_ASSERT(it >= Data && it < Data + Size); const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data; return (int)off; }

    


    

    
1898

    
    

    
};

    


    

    
1899

    
    

    
IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_RESTORE

    


    

    
1900

    
    

    

    


    

    
1901

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
1902

    
    

    
// [SECTION] ImGuiStyle

    


    

    
1903

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
1904

    
    

    
// You may modify the ImGui::GetStyle() main instance during initialization and before NewFrame().

    


    

    
1905

    
    

    
// During the frame, use ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_XXXX)/PopStyleVar() to alter the main style values,

    


    

    
1906

    
    

    
// and ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_XXX)/PopStyleColor() for colors.

    


    

    
1907

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
1908

    
    

    

    


    

    
1909

    
    

    
struct ImGuiStyle

    


    

    
1910

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
1911

    
    

    
    float       Alpha;                      // Global alpha applies to everything in Dear ImGui.

    


    

    
1912

    
    

    
    float       DisabledAlpha;              // Additional alpha multiplier applied by BeginDisabled(). Multiply over current value of Alpha.

    


    

    
1913

    
    

    
    ImVec2      WindowPadding;              // Padding within a window.

    


    

    
1914

    
    

    
    float       WindowRounding;             // Radius of window corners rounding. Set to 0.0f to have rectangular windows. Large values tend to lead to variety of artifacts and are not recommended.

    


    

    
1915

    
    

    
    float       WindowBorderSize;           // Thickness of border around windows. Generally set to 0.0f or 1.0f. (Other values are not well tested and more CPU/GPU costly).

    


    

    
1916

    
    

    
    ImVec2      WindowMinSize;              // Minimum window size. This is a global setting. If you want to constrain individual windows, use SetNextWindowSizeConstraints().

    


    

    
1917

    
    

    
    ImVec2      WindowTitleAlign;           // Alignment for title bar text. Defaults to (0.0f,0.5f) for left-aligned,vertically centered.

    


    

    
1918

    
    

    
    ImGuiDir    WindowMenuButtonPosition;   // Side of the collapsing/docking button in the title bar (None/Left/Right). Defaults to ImGuiDir_Left.

    


    

    
1919

    
    

    
    float       ChildRounding;              // Radius of child window corners rounding. Set to 0.0f to have rectangular windows.

    


    

    
1920

    
    

    
    float       ChildBorderSize;            // Thickness of border around child windows. Generally set to 0.0f or 1.0f. (Other values are not well tested and more CPU/GPU costly).

    


    

    
1921

    
    

    
    float       PopupRounding;              // Radius of popup window corners rounding. (Note that tooltip windows use WindowRounding)

    


    

    
1922

    
    

    
    float       PopupBorderSize;            // Thickness of border around popup/tooltip windows. Generally set to 0.0f or 1.0f. (Other values are not well tested and more CPU/GPU costly).

    


    

    
1923

    
    

    
    ImVec2      FramePadding;               // Padding within a framed rectangle (used by most widgets).

    


    

    
1924

    
    

    
    float       FrameRounding;              // Radius of frame corners rounding. Set to 0.0f to have rectangular frame (used by most widgets).

    


    

    
1925

    
    

    
    float       FrameBorderSize;            // Thickness of border around frames. Generally set to 0.0f or 1.0f. (Other values are not well tested and more CPU/GPU costly).

    


    

    
1926

    
    

    
    ImVec2      ItemSpacing;                // Horizontal and vertical spacing between widgets/lines.

    


    

    
1927

    
    

    
    ImVec2      ItemInnerSpacing;           // Horizontal and vertical spacing between within elements of a composed widget (e.g. a slider and its label).

    


    

    
1928

    
    

    
    ImVec2      CellPadding;                // Padding within a table cell

    


    

    
1929

    
    

    
    ImVec2      TouchExtraPadding;          // Expand reactive bounding box for touch-based system where touch position is not accurate enough. Unfortunately we don't sort widgets so priority on overlap will always be given to the first widget. So don't grow this too much!

    


    

    
1930

    
    

    
    float       IndentSpacing;              // Horizontal indentation when e.g. entering a tree node. Generally == (FontSize + FramePadding.x*2).

    


    

    
1931

    
    

    
    float       ColumnsMinSpacing;          // Minimum horizontal spacing between two columns. Preferably > (FramePadding.x + 1).

    


    

    
1932

    
    

    
    float       ScrollbarSize;              // Width of the vertical scrollbar, Height of the horizontal scrollbar.

    


    

    
1933

    
    

    
    float       ScrollbarRounding;          // Radius of grab corners for scrollbar.

    


    

    
1934

    
    

    
    float       GrabMinSize;                // Minimum width/height of a grab box for slider/scrollbar.

    


    

    
1935

    
    

    
    float       GrabRounding;               // Radius of grabs corners rounding. Set to 0.0f to have rectangular slider grabs.

    


    

    
1936

    
    

    
    float       LogSliderDeadzone;          // The size in pixels of the dead-zone around zero on logarithmic sliders that cross zero.

    


    

    
1937

    
    

    
    float       TabRounding;                // Radius of upper corners of a tab. Set to 0.0f to have rectangular tabs.

    


    

    
1938

    
    

    
    float       TabBorderSize;              // Thickness of border around tabs.

    


    

    
1939

    
    

    
    float       TabMinWidthForCloseButton;  // Minimum width for close button to appear on an unselected tab when hovered. Set to 0.0f to always show when hovering, set to FLT_MAX to never show close button unless selected.

    


    

    
1940

    
    

    
    ImGuiDir    ColorButtonPosition;        // Side of the color button in the ColorEdit4 widget (left/right). Defaults to ImGuiDir_Right.

    


    

    
1941

    
    

    
    ImVec2      ButtonTextAlign;            // Alignment of button text when button is larger than text. Defaults to (0.5f, 0.5f) (centered).

    


    

    
1942

    
    

    
    ImVec2      SelectableTextAlign;        // Alignment of selectable text. Defaults to (0.0f, 0.0f) (top-left aligned). It's generally important to keep this left-aligned if you want to lay multiple items on a same line.

    


    

    
1943

    
    

    
    ImVec2      DisplayWindowPadding;       // Window position are clamped to be visible within the display area or monitors by at least this amount. Only applies to regular windows.

    


    

    
1944

    
    

    
    ImVec2      DisplaySafeAreaPadding;     // If you cannot see the edges of your screen (e.g. on a TV) increase the safe area padding. Apply to popups/tooltips as well regular windows. NB: Prefer configuring your TV sets correctly!

    


    

    
1945

    
    

    
    float       MouseCursorScale;           // Scale software rendered mouse cursor (when io.MouseDrawCursor is enabled). We apply per-monitor DPI scaling over this scale. May be removed later.

    


    

    
1946

    
    

    
    bool        AntiAliasedLines;           // Enable anti-aliased lines/borders. Disable if you are really tight on CPU/GPU. Latched at the beginning of the frame (copied to ImDrawList).

    


    

    
1947

    
    

    
    bool        AntiAliasedLinesUseTex;     // Enable anti-aliased lines/borders using textures where possible. Require backend to render with bilinear filtering (NOT point/nearest filtering). Latched at the beginning of the frame (copied to ImDrawList).

    


    

    
1948

    
    

    
    bool        AntiAliasedFill;            // Enable anti-aliased edges around filled shapes (rounded rectangles, circles, etc.). Disable if you are really tight on CPU/GPU. Latched at the beginning of the frame (copied to ImDrawList).

    


    

    
1949

    
    

    
    float       CurveTessellationTol;       // Tessellation tolerance when using PathBezierCurveTo() without a specific number of segments. Decrease for highly tessellated curves (higher quality, more polygons), increase to reduce quality.

    


    

    
1950

    
    

    
    float       CircleTessellationMaxError; // Maximum error (in pixels) allowed when using AddCircle()/AddCircleFilled() or drawing rounded corner rectangles with no explicit segment count specified. Decrease for higher quality but more geometry.

    


    

    
1951

    
    

    
    ImVec4      Colors[ImGuiCol_COUNT];

    


    

    
1952

    
    

    

    


    

    
1953

    
    

    
    IMGUI_API ImGuiStyle();

    


    

    
1954

    
    

    
    IMGUI_API void ScaleAllSizes(float scale_factor);

    


    

    
1955

    
    

    
};

    


    

    
1956

    
    

    

    


    

    
1957

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
1958

    
    

    
// [SECTION] ImGuiIO

    


    

    
1959

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
1960

    
    

    
// Communicate most settings and inputs/outputs to Dear ImGui using this structure.

    


    

    
1961

    
    

    
// Access via ImGui::GetIO(). Read 'Programmer guide' section in .cpp file for general usage.

    


    

    
1962

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
1963

    
    

    

    


    

    
1964

    
    

    
// [Internal] Storage used by IsKeyDown(), IsKeyPressed() etc functions.

    


    

    
1965

    
    

    
// If prior to 1.87 you used io.KeysDownDuration[] (which was marked as internal), you should use GetKeyData(key)->DownDuration and *NOT* io.KeysData[key]->DownDuration.

    


    

    
1966

    
    

    
struct ImGuiKeyData

    


    

    
1967

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
1968

    
    

    
    bool        Down;               // True for if key is down

    


    

    
1969

    
    

    
    float       DownDuration;       // Duration the key has been down (<0.0f: not pressed, 0.0f: just pressed, >0.0f: time held)

    


    

    
1970

    
    

    
    float       DownDurationPrev;   // Last frame duration the key has been down

    


    

    
1971

    
    

    
    float       AnalogValue;        // 0.0f..1.0f for gamepad values

    


    

    
1972

    
    

    
};

    


    

    
1973

    
    

    

    


    

    
1974

    
    

    
struct ImGuiIO

    


    

    
1975

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
1976

    
    

    
    //------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
1977

    
    

    
    // Configuration                            // Default value

    


    

    
1978

    
    

    
    //------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
1979

    
    

    

    


    

    
1980

    
    

    
    ImGuiConfigFlags   ConfigFlags;             // = 0              // See ImGuiConfigFlags_ enum. Set by user/application. Gamepad/keyboard navigation options, etc.

    


    

    
1981

    
    

    
    ImGuiBackendFlags  BackendFlags;            // = 0              // See ImGuiBackendFlags_ enum. Set by backend (imgui_impl_xxx files or custom backend) to communicate features supported by the backend.

    


    

    
1982

    
    

    
    ImVec2      DisplaySize;                    // <unset>          // Main display size, in pixels (generally == GetMainViewport()->Size). May change every frame.

    


    

    
1983

    
    

    
    float       DeltaTime;                      // = 1.0f/60.0f     // Time elapsed since last frame, in seconds. May change every frame.

    


    

    
1984

    
    

    
    float       IniSavingRate;                  // = 5.0f           // Minimum time between saving positions/sizes to .ini file, in seconds.

    


    

    
1985

    
    

    
    const char* IniFilename;                    // = "imgui.ini"    // Path to .ini file (important: default "imgui.ini" is relative to current working dir!). Set NULL to disable automatic .ini loading/saving or if you want to manually call LoadIniSettingsXXX() / SaveIniSettingsXXX() functions.

    


    

    
1986

    
    

    
    const char* LogFilename;                    // = "imgui_log.txt"// Path to .log file (default parameter to ImGui::LogToFile when no file is specified).

    


    

    
1987

    
    

    
    float       MouseDoubleClickTime;           // = 0.30f          // Time for a double-click, in seconds.

    


    

    
1988

    
    

    
    float       MouseDoubleClickMaxDist;        // = 6.0f           // Distance threshold to stay in to validate a double-click, in pixels.

    


    

    
1989

    
    

    
    float       MouseDragThreshold;             // = 6.0f           // Distance threshold before considering we are dragging.

    


    

    
1990

    
    

    
    float       KeyRepeatDelay;                 // = 0.275f         // When holding a key/button, time before it starts repeating, in seconds (for buttons in Repeat mode, etc.).

    


    

    
1991

    
    

    
    float       KeyRepeatRate;                  // = 0.050f         // When holding a key/button, rate at which it repeats, in seconds.

    


    

    
1992

    
    

    
    float       HoverDelayNormal;               // = 0.30 sec       // Delay on hovering before IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayNormal) returns true.

    


    

    
1993

    
    

    
    float       HoverDelayShort;                // = 0.10 sec       // Delay on hovering before IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayShort) returns true.

    


    

    
1994

    
    

    
    void*       UserData;                       // = NULL           // Store your own data for retrieval by callbacks.

    


    

    
1995

    
    

    

    


    

    
1996

    
    

    
    ImFontAtlas*Fonts;                          // <auto>           // Font atlas: load, rasterize and pack one or more fonts into a single texture.

    


    

    
1997

    
    

    
    float       FontGlobalScale;                // = 1.0f           // Global scale all fonts

    


    

    
1998

    
    

    
    bool        FontAllowUserScaling;           // = false          // Allow user scaling text of individual window with CTRL+Wheel.

    


    

    
1999

    
    

    
    ImFont*     FontDefault;                    // = NULL           // Font to use on NewFrame(). Use NULL to uses Fonts->Fonts[0].

    


    

    
2000

    
    

    
    ImVec2      DisplayFramebufferScale;        // = (1, 1)         // For retina display or other situations where window coordinates are different from framebuffer coordinates. This generally ends up in ImDrawData::FramebufferScale.

    


    

    
2001

    
    

    

    


    

    
2002

    
    

    
    // Docking options (when ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable is set)

    


    

    
2003

    
    

    
    bool        ConfigDockingNoSplit;           // = false          // Simplified docking mode: disable window splitting, so docking is limited to merging multiple windows together into tab-bars.

    


    

    
2004

    
    

    
    bool        ConfigDockingWithShift;         // = false          // Enable docking with holding Shift key (reduce visual noise, allows dropping in wider space)

    


    

    
2005

    
    

    
    bool        ConfigDockingAlwaysTabBar;      // = false          // [BETA] [FIXME: This currently creates regression with auto-sizing and general overhead] Make every single floating window display within a docking node.

    


    

    
2006

    
    

    
    bool        ConfigDockingTransparentPayload;// = false          // [BETA] Make window or viewport transparent when docking and only display docking boxes on the target viewport. Useful if rendering of multiple viewport cannot be synced. Best used with ConfigViewportsNoAutoMerge.

    


    

    
2007

    
    

    

    


    

    
2008

    
    

    
    // Viewport options (when ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable is set)

    


    

    
2009

    
    

    
    bool        ConfigViewportsNoAutoMerge;     // = false;         // Set to make all floating imgui windows always create their own viewport. Otherwise, they are merged into the main host viewports when overlapping it. May also set ImGuiViewportFlags_NoAutoMerge on individual viewport.

    


    

    
2010

    
    

    
    bool        ConfigViewportsNoTaskBarIcon;   // = false          // Disable default OS task bar icon flag for secondary viewports. When a viewport doesn't want a task bar icon, ImGuiViewportFlags_NoTaskBarIcon will be set on it.

    


    

    
2011

    
    

    
    bool        ConfigViewportsNoDecoration;    // = true           // Disable default OS window decoration flag for secondary viewports. When a viewport doesn't want window decorations, ImGuiViewportFlags_NoDecoration will be set on it. Enabling decoration can create subsequent issues at OS levels (e.g. minimum window size).

    


    

    
2012

    
    

    
    bool        ConfigViewportsNoDefaultParent; // = false          // Disable default OS parenting to main viewport for secondary viewports. By default, viewports are marked with ParentViewportId = <main_viewport>, expecting the platform backend to setup a parent/child relationship between the OS windows (some backend may ignore this). Set to true if you want the default to be 0, then all viewports will be top-level OS windows.

    


    

    
2013

    
    

    

    


    

    
2014

    
    

    
    // Miscellaneous options

    


    

    
2015

    
    

    
    bool        MouseDrawCursor;                // = false          // Request ImGui to draw a mouse cursor for you (if you are on a platform without a mouse cursor). Cannot be easily renamed to 'io.ConfigXXX' because this is frequently used by backend implementations.

    


    

    
2016

    
    

    
    bool        ConfigMacOSXBehaviors;          // = defined(__APPLE__) // OS X style: Text editing cursor movement using Alt instead of Ctrl, Shortcuts using Cmd/Super instead of Ctrl, Line/Text Start and End using Cmd+Arrows instead of Home/End, Double click selects by word instead of selecting whole text, Multi-selection in lists uses Cmd/Super instead of Ctrl.

    


    

    
2017

    
    

    
    bool        ConfigInputTrickleEventQueue;   // = true           // Enable input queue trickling: some types of events submitted during the same frame (e.g. button down + up) will be spread over multiple frames, improving interactions with low framerates.

    


    

    
2018

    
    

    
    bool        ConfigInputTextCursorBlink;     // = true           // Enable blinking cursor (optional as some users consider it to be distracting).

    


    

    
2019

    
    

    
    bool        ConfigInputTextEnterKeepActive; // = false          // [BETA] Pressing Enter will keep item active and select contents (single-line only).

    


    

    
2020

    
    

    
    bool        ConfigDragClickToInputText;     // = false          // [BETA] Enable turning DragXXX widgets into text input with a simple mouse click-release (without moving). Not desirable on devices without a keyboard.

    


    

    
2021

    
    

    
    bool        ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges;   // = true           // Enable resizing of windows from their edges and from the lower-left corner. This requires (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors) because it needs mouse cursor feedback. (This used to be a per-window ImGuiWindowFlags_ResizeFromAnySide flag)

    


    

    
2022

    
    

    
    bool        ConfigWindowsMoveFromTitleBarOnly; // = false       // Enable allowing to move windows only when clicking on their title bar. Does not apply to windows without a title bar.

    


    

    
2023

    
    

    
    float       ConfigMemoryCompactTimer;       // = 60.0f          // Timer (in seconds) to free transient windows/tables memory buffers when unused. Set to -1.0f to disable.

    


    

    
2024

    
    

    

    


    

    
2025

    
    

    
    //------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
2026

    
    

    
    // Platform Functions

    


    

    
2027

    
    

    
    // (the imgui_impl_xxxx backend files are setting those up for you)

    


    

    
2028

    
    

    
    //------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
2029

    
    

    

    


    

    
2030

    
    

    
    // Optional: Platform/Renderer backend name (informational only! will be displayed in About Window) + User data for backend/wrappers to store their own stuff.

    


    

    
2031

    
    

    
    const char* BackendPlatformName;            // = NULL

    


    

    
2032

    
    

    
    const char* BackendRendererName;            // = NULL

    


    

    
2033

    
    

    
    void*       BackendPlatformUserData;        // = NULL           // User data for platform backend

    


    

    
2034

    
    

    
    void*       BackendRendererUserData;        // = NULL           // User data for renderer backend

    


    

    
2035

    
    

    
    void*       BackendLanguageUserData;        // = NULL           // User data for non C++ programming language backend

    


    

    
2036

    
    

    

    


    

    
2037

    
    

    
    // Optional: Access OS clipboard

    


    

    
2038

    
    

    
    // (default to use native Win32 clipboard on Windows, otherwise uses a private clipboard. Override to access OS clipboard on other architectures)

    


    

    
2039

    
    

    
    const char* (*GetClipboardTextFn)(void* user_data);

    


    

    
2040

    
    

    
    void        (*SetClipboardTextFn)(void* user_data, const char* text);

    


    

    
2041

    
    

    
    void*       ClipboardUserData;

    


    

    
2042

    
    

    

    


    

    
2043

    
    

    
    // Optional: Notify OS Input Method Editor of the screen position of your cursor for text input position (e.g. when using Japanese/Chinese IME on Windows)

    


    

    
2044

    
    

    
    // (default to use native imm32 api on Windows)

    


    

    
2045

    
    

    
    void        (*SetPlatformImeDataFn)(ImGuiViewport* viewport, ImGuiPlatformImeData* data);

    


    

    
2046

    
    

    
#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS

    


    

    
2047

    
    

    
    void*       ImeWindowHandle;                // = NULL           // [Obsolete] Set ImGuiViewport::PlatformHandleRaw instead. Set this to your HWND to get automatic IME cursor positioning.

    


    

    
2048

    
    

    
#else

    


    

    
2049

    
    

    
    void*       _UnusedPadding;                                     // Unused field to keep data structure the same size.

    


    

    
2050

    
    

    
#endif

    


    

    
2051

    
    

    

    


    

    
2052

    
    

    
    //------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
2053

    
    

    
    // Input - Call before calling NewFrame()

    


    

    
2054

    
    

    
    //------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
2055

    
    

    

    


    

    
2056

    
    

    
    // Input Functions

    


    

    
2057

    
    

    
    IMGUI_API void  AddKeyEvent(ImGuiKey key, bool down);                   // Queue a new key down/up event. Key should be "translated" (as in, generally ImGuiKey_A matches the key end-user would use to emit an 'A' character)

    


    

    
2058

    
    

    
    IMGUI_API void  AddKeyAnalogEvent(ImGuiKey key, bool down, float v);    // Queue a new key down/up event for analog values (e.g. ImGuiKey_Gamepad_ values). Dead-zones should be handled by the backend.

    


    

    
2059

    
    

    
    IMGUI_API void  AddMousePosEvent(float x, float y);                     // Queue a mouse position update. Use -FLT_MAX,-FLT_MAX to signify no mouse (e.g. app not focused and not hovered)

    


    

    
2060

    
    

    
    IMGUI_API void  AddMouseButtonEvent(int button, bool down);             // Queue a mouse button change

    


    

    
2061

    
    

    
    IMGUI_API void  AddMouseWheelEvent(float wh_x, float wh_y);             // Queue a mouse wheel update

    


    

    
2062

    
    

    
    IMGUI_API void  AddMouseViewportEvent(ImGuiID id);                      // Queue a mouse hovered viewport. Requires backend to set ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseHoveredViewport to call this (for multi-viewport support).

    


    

    
2063

    
    

    
    IMGUI_API void  AddFocusEvent(bool focused);                            // Queue a gain/loss of focus for the application (generally based on OS/platform focus of your window)

    


    

    
2064

    
    

    
    IMGUI_API void  AddInputCharacter(unsigned int c);                      // Queue a new character input

    


    

    
2065

    
    

    
    IMGUI_API void  AddInputCharacterUTF16(ImWchar16 c);                    // Queue a new character input from a UTF-16 character, it can be a surrogate

    


    

    
2066

    
    

    
    IMGUI_API void  AddInputCharactersUTF8(const char* str);                // Queue a new characters input from a UTF-8 string

    


    

    
2067

    
    

    

    


    

    
2068

    
    

    
    IMGUI_API void  SetKeyEventNativeData(ImGuiKey key, int native_keycode, int native_scancode, int native_legacy_index = -1); // [Optional] Specify index for legacy <1.87 IsKeyXXX() functions with native indices + specify native keycode, scancode.

    


    

    
2069

    
    

    
    IMGUI_API void  SetAppAcceptingEvents(bool accepting_events);           // Set master flag for accepting key/mouse/text events (default to true). Useful if you have native dialog boxes that are interrupting your application loop/refresh, and you want to disable events being queued while your app is frozen.

    


    

    
2070

    
    

    
    IMGUI_API void  ClearInputCharacters();                                 // [Internal] Clear the text input buffer manually

    


    

    
2071

    
    

    
    IMGUI_API void  ClearInputKeys();                                       // [Internal] Release all keys

    


    

    
2072

    
    

    

    


    

    
2073

    
    

    
    //------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
2074

    
    

    
    // Output - Updated by NewFrame() or EndFrame()/Render()

    


    

    
2075

    
    

    
    // (when reading from the io.WantCaptureMouse, io.WantCaptureKeyboard flags to dispatch your inputs, it is

    


    

    
2076

    
    

    
    //  generally easier and more correct to use their state BEFORE calling NewFrame(). See FAQ for details!)

    


    

    
2077

    
    

    
    //------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
2078

    
    

    

    


    

    
2079

    
    

    
    bool        WantCaptureMouse;                   // Set when Dear ImGui will use mouse inputs, in this case do not dispatch them to your main game/application (either way, always pass on mouse inputs to imgui). (e.g. unclicked mouse is hovering over an imgui window, widget is active, mouse was clicked over an imgui window, etc.).

    


    

    
2080

    
    

    
    bool        WantCaptureKeyboard;                // Set when Dear ImGui will use keyboard inputs, in this case do not dispatch them to your main game/application (either way, always pass keyboard inputs to imgui). (e.g. InputText active, or an imgui window is focused and navigation is enabled, etc.).

    


    

    
2081

    
    

    
    bool        WantTextInput;                      // Mobile/console: when set, you may display an on-screen keyboard. This is set by Dear ImGui when it wants textual keyboard input to happen (e.g. when a InputText widget is active).

    


    

    
2082

    
    

    
    bool        WantSetMousePos;                    // MousePos has been altered, backend should reposition mouse on next frame. Rarely used! Set only when ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos flag is enabled.

    


    

    
2083

    
    

    
    bool        WantSaveIniSettings;                // When manual .ini load/save is active (io.IniFilename == NULL), this will be set to notify your application that you can call SaveIniSettingsToMemory() and save yourself. Important: clear io.WantSaveIniSettings yourself after saving!

    


    

    
2084

    
    

    
    bool        NavActive;                          // Keyboard/Gamepad navigation is currently allowed (will handle ImGuiKey_NavXXX events) = a window is focused and it doesn't use the ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs flag.

    


    

    
2085

    
    

    
    bool        NavVisible;                         // Keyboard/Gamepad navigation is visible and allowed (will handle ImGuiKey_NavXXX events).

    


    

    
2086

    
    

    
    float       Framerate;                          // Estimate of application framerate (rolling average over 60 frames, based on io.DeltaTime), in frame per second. Solely for convenience. Slow applications may not want to use a moving average or may want to reset underlying buffers occasionally.

    


    

    
2087

    
    

    
    int         MetricsRenderVertices;              // Vertices output during last call to Render()

    


    

    
2088

    
    

    
    int         MetricsRenderIndices;               // Indices output during last call to Render() = number of triangles * 3

    


    

    
2089

    
    

    
    int         MetricsRenderWindows;               // Number of visible windows

    


    

    
2090

    
    

    
    int         MetricsActiveWindows;               // Number of active windows

    


    

    
2091

    
    

    
    int         MetricsActiveAllocations;           // Number of active allocations, updated by MemAlloc/MemFree based on current context. May be off if you have multiple imgui contexts.

    


    

    
2092

    
    

    
    ImVec2      MouseDelta;                         // Mouse delta. Note that this is zero if either current or previous position are invalid (-FLT_MAX,-FLT_MAX), so a disappearing/reappearing mouse won't have a huge delta.

    


    

    
2093

    
    

    

    


    

    
2094

    
    

    
    // Legacy: before 1.87, we required backend to fill io.KeyMap[] (imgui->native map) during initialization and io.KeysDown[] (native indices) every frame.

    


    

    
2095

    
    

    
    // This is still temporarily supported as a legacy feature. However the new preferred scheme is for backend to call io.AddKeyEvent().

    


    

    
2096

    
    

    
    //   Old (<1.87):  ImGui::IsKeyPressed(ImGui::GetIO().KeyMap[ImGuiKey_Space]) --> New (1.87+) ImGui::IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Space)

    


    

    
2097

    
    

    
#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_KEYIO

    


    

    
2098

    
    

    
    int         KeyMap[ImGuiKey_COUNT];             // [LEGACY] Input: map of indices into the KeysDown[512] entries array which represent your "native" keyboard state. The first 512 are now unused and should be kept zero. Legacy backend will write into KeyMap[] using ImGuiKey_ indices which are always >512.

    


    

    
2099

    
    

    
    bool        KeysDown[ImGuiKey_COUNT];           // [LEGACY] Input: Keyboard keys that are pressed (ideally left in the "native" order your engine has access to keyboard keys, so you can use your own defines/enums for keys). This used to be [512] sized. It is now ImGuiKey_COUNT to allow legacy io.KeysDown[GetKeyIndex(...)] to work without an overflow.

    


    

    
2100

    
    

    
    float       NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_COUNT];     // [LEGACY] Since 1.88, NavInputs[] was removed. Backends from 1.60 to 1.86 won't build. Feed gamepad inputs via io.AddKeyEvent() and ImGuiKey_GamepadXXX enums.

    


    

    
2101

    
    

    
#endif

    


    

    
2102

    
    

    

    


    

    
2103

    
    

    
    //------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
2104

    
    

    
    // [Internal] Dear ImGui will maintain those fields. Forward compatibility not guaranteed!

    


    

    
2105

    
    

    
    //------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
2106

    
    

    

    


    

    
2107

    
    

    
    // Main Input State

    


    

    
2108

    
    

    
    // (this block used to be written by backend, since 1.87 it is best to NOT write to those directly, call the AddXXX functions above instead)

    


    

    
2109

    
    

    
    // (reading from those variables is fair game, as they are extremely unlikely to be moving anywhere)

    


    

    
2110

    
    

    
    ImVec2      MousePos;                           // Mouse position, in pixels. Set to ImVec2(-FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX) if mouse is unavailable (on another screen, etc.)

    


    

    
2111

    
    

    
    bool        MouseDown[5];                       // Mouse buttons: 0=left, 1=right, 2=middle + extras (ImGuiMouseButton_COUNT == 5). Dear ImGui mostly uses left and right buttons. Other buttons allow us to track if the mouse is being used by your application + available to user as a convenience via IsMouse** API.

    


    

    
2112

    
    

    
    float       MouseWheel;                         // Mouse wheel Vertical: 1 unit scrolls about 5 lines text.

    


    

    
2113

    
    

    
    float       MouseWheelH;                        // Mouse wheel Horizontal. Most users don't have a mouse with a horizontal wheel, may not be filled by all backends.

    


    

    
2114

    
    

    
    ImGuiID     MouseHoveredViewport;               // (Optional) Modify using io.AddMouseViewportEvent(). With multi-viewports: viewport the OS mouse is hovering. If possible _IGNORING_ viewports with the ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs flag is much better (few backends can handle that). Set io.BackendFlags |= ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseHoveredViewport if you can provide this info. If you don't imgui will infer the value using the rectangles and last focused time of the viewports it knows about (ignoring other OS windows).

    


    

    
2115

    
    

    
    bool        KeyCtrl;                            // Keyboard modifier down: Control

    


    

    
2116

    
    

    
    bool        KeyShift;                           // Keyboard modifier down: Shift

    


    

    
2117

    
    

    
    bool        KeyAlt;                             // Keyboard modifier down: Alt

    


    

    
2118

    
    

    
    bool        KeySuper;                           // Keyboard modifier down: Cmd/Super/Windows

    


    

    
2119

    
    

    

    


    

    
2120

    
    

    
    // Other state maintained from data above + IO function calls

    


    

    
2121

    
    

    
    ImGuiKeyChord KeyMods;                          // Key mods flags (any of ImGuiMod_Ctrl/ImGuiMod_Shift/ImGuiMod_Alt/ImGuiMod_Super flags, same as io.KeyCtrl/KeyShift/KeyAlt/KeySuper but merged into flags). Read-only, updated by NewFrame()

    


    

    
2122

    
    

    
    ImGuiKeyData  KeysData[ImGuiKey_KeysData_SIZE]; // Key state for all known keys. Use IsKeyXXX() functions to access this.

    


    

    
2123

    
    

    
    bool        WantCaptureMouseUnlessPopupClose;   // Alternative to WantCaptureMouse: (WantCaptureMouse == true && WantCaptureMouseUnlessPopupClose == false) when a click over void is expected to close a popup.

    


    

    
2124

    
    

    
    ImVec2      MousePosPrev;                       // Previous mouse position (note that MouseDelta is not necessary == MousePos-MousePosPrev, in case either position is invalid)

    


    

    
2125

    
    

    
    ImVec2      MouseClickedPos[5];                 // Position at time of clicking

    


    

    
2126

    
    

    
    double      MouseClickedTime[5];                // Time of last click (used to figure out double-click)

    


    

    
2127

    
    

    
    bool        MouseClicked[5];                    // Mouse button went from !Down to Down (same as MouseClickedCount[x] != 0)

    


    

    
2128

    
    

    
    bool        MouseDoubleClicked[5];              // Has mouse button been double-clicked? (same as MouseClickedCount[x] == 2)

    


    

    
2129

    
    

    
    ImU16       MouseClickedCount[5];               // == 0 (not clicked), == 1 (same as MouseClicked[]), == 2 (double-clicked), == 3 (triple-clicked) etc. when going from !Down to Down

    


    

    
2130

    
    

    
    ImU16       MouseClickedLastCount[5];           // Count successive number of clicks. Stays valid after mouse release. Reset after another click is done.

    


    

    
2131

    
    

    
    bool        MouseReleased[5];                   // Mouse button went from Down to !Down

    


    

    
2132

    
    

    
    bool        MouseDownOwned[5];                  // Track if button was clicked inside a dear imgui window or over void blocked by a popup. We don't request mouse capture from the application if click started outside ImGui bounds.

    


    

    
2133

    
    

    
    bool        MouseDownOwnedUnlessPopupClose[5];  // Track if button was clicked inside a dear imgui window.

    


    

    
2134

    
    

    
    float       MouseDownDuration[5];               // Duration the mouse button has been down (0.0f == just clicked)

    


    

    
2135

    
    

    
    float       MouseDownDurationPrev[5];           // Previous time the mouse button has been down

    


    

    
2136

    
    

    
    ImVec2      MouseDragMaxDistanceAbs[5];         // Maximum distance, absolute, on each axis, of how much mouse has traveled from the clicking point

    


    

    
2137

    
    

    
    float       MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr[5];         // Squared maximum distance of how much mouse has traveled from the clicking point (used for moving thresholds)

    


    

    
2138

    
    

    
    float       PenPressure;                        // Touch/Pen pressure (0.0f to 1.0f, should be >0.0f only when MouseDown[0] == true). Helper storage currently unused by Dear ImGui.

    


    

    
2139

    
    

    
    bool        AppFocusLost;                       // Only modify via AddFocusEvent()

    


    

    
2140

    
    

    
    bool        AppAcceptingEvents;                 // Only modify via SetAppAcceptingEvents()

    


    

    
2141

    
    

    
    ImS8        BackendUsingLegacyKeyArrays;        // -1: unknown, 0: using AddKeyEvent(), 1: using legacy io.KeysDown[]

    


    

    
2142

    
    

    
    bool        BackendUsingLegacyNavInputArray;    // 0: using AddKeyAnalogEvent(), 1: writing to legacy io.NavInputs[] directly

    


    

    
2143

    
    

    
    ImWchar16   InputQueueSurrogate;                // For AddInputCharacterUTF16()

    


    

    
2144

    
    

    
    ImVector<ImWchar> InputQueueCharacters;         // Queue of _characters_ input (obtained by platform backend). Fill using AddInputCharacter() helper.

    


    

    
2145

    
    

    

    


    

    
2146

    
    

    
    IMGUI_API   ImGuiIO();

    


    

    
2147

    
    

    
};

    


    

    
2148

    
    

    

    


    

    
2149

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
2150

    
    

    
// [SECTION] Misc data structures

    


    

    
2151

    
    

    
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    


    

    
2152

    
    

    

    


    

    
2153

    
    

    
// Shared state of InputText(), passed as an argument to your callback when a ImGuiInputTextFlags_Callback* flag is used.

    


    

    
2154

    
    

    
// The callback function should return 0 by default.

    


    

    
2155

    
    

    
// Callbacks (follow a flag name and see comments in ImGuiInputTextFlags_ declarations for more details)

    


    

    
2156

    
    

    
// - ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackEdit:        Callback on buffer edit (note that InputText() already returns true on edit, the callback is useful mainly to manipulate the underlying buffer while focus is active)

    


    

    
2157

    
    

    
// - ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackAlways:      Callback on each iteration

    


    

    
2158

    
    

    
// - ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion:  Callback on pressing TAB

    


    

    
2159

    
    

    
// - ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory:     Callback on pressing Up/Down arrows

    


    

    
2160

    
    

    
// - ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCharFilter:  Callback on character inputs to replace or discard them. Modify 'EventChar' to replace or discard, or return 1 in callback to discard.

    


    

    
2161

    
    

    
// - ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize:      Callback on buffer capacity changes request (beyond 'buf_size' parameter value), allowing the string to grow.

    


    

    
2162

    
    

    
struct ImGuiInputTextCallbackData

    


    

    
2163

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
2164

    
    

    
    ImGuiInputTextFlags EventFlag;      // One ImGuiInputTextFlags_Callback*    // Read-only

    


    

    
2165

    
    

    
    ImGuiInputTextFlags Flags;          // What user passed to InputText()      // Read-only

    


    

    
2166

    
    

    
    void*               UserData;       // What user passed to InputText()      // Read-only

    


    

    
2167

    
    

    

    


    

    
2168

    
    

    
    // Arguments for the different callback events

    


    

    
2169

    
    

    
    // - To modify the text buffer in a callback, prefer using the InsertChars() / DeleteChars() function. InsertChars() will take care of calling the resize callback if necessary.

    


    

    
2170

    
    

    
    // - If you know your edits are not going to resize the underlying buffer allocation, you may modify the contents of 'Buf[]' directly. You need to update 'BufTextLen' accordingly (0 <= BufTextLen < BufSize) and set 'BufDirty'' to true so InputText can update its internal state.

    


    

    
2171

    
    

    
    ImWchar             EventChar;      // Character input                      // Read-write   // [CharFilter] Replace character with another one, or set to zero to drop. return 1 is equivalent to setting EventChar=0;

    


    

    
2172

    
    

    
    ImGuiKey            EventKey;       // Key pressed (Up/Down/TAB)            // Read-only    // [Completion,History]

    


    

    
2173

    
    

    
    char*               Buf;            // Text buffer                          // Read-write   // [Resize] Can replace pointer / [Completion,History,Always] Only write to pointed data, don't replace the actual pointer!

    


    

    
2174

    
    

    
    int                 BufTextLen;     // Text length (in bytes)               // Read-write   // [Resize,Completion,History,Always] Exclude zero-terminator storage. In C land: == strlen(some_text), in C++ land: string.length()

    


    

    
2175

    
    

    
    int                 BufSize;        // Buffer size (in bytes) = capacity+1  // Read-only    // [Resize,Completion,History,Always] Include zero-terminator storage. In C land == ARRAYSIZE(my_char_array), in C++ land: string.capacity()+1

    


    

    
2176

    
    

    
    bool                BufDirty;       // Set if you modify Buf/BufTextLen!    // Write        // [Completion,History,Always]

    


    

    
2177

    
    

    
    int                 CursorPos;      //                                      // Read-write   // [Completion,History,Always]

    


    

    
2178

    
    

    
    int                 SelectionStart; //                                      // Read-write   // [Completion,History,Always] == to SelectionEnd when no selection)

    


    

    
2179

    
    

    
    int                 SelectionEnd;   //                                      // Read-write   // [Completion,History,Always]

    


    

    
2180

    
    

    

    


    

    
2181

    
    

    
    // Helper functions for text manipulation.

    


    

    
2182

    
    

    
    // Use those function to benefit from the CallbackResize behaviors. Calling those function reset the selection.

    


    

    
2183

    
    

    
    IMGUI_API ImGuiInputTextCallbackData();

    


    

    
2184

    
    

    
    IMGUI_API void      DeleteChars(int pos, int bytes_count);

    


    

    
2185

    
    

    
    IMGUI_API void      InsertChars(int pos, const char* text, const char* text_end = NULL);

    


    

    
2186

    
    

    
    void                SelectAll()             { SelectionStart = 0; SelectionEnd = BufTextLen; }

    


    

    
2187

    
    

    
    void                ClearSelection()        { SelectionStart = SelectionEnd = BufTextLen; }

    


    

    
2188

    
    

    
    bool                HasSelection() const    { return SelectionStart != SelectionEnd; }

    


    

    
2189

    
    

    
};

    


    

    
2190

    
    

    

    


    

    
2191

    
    

    
// Resizing callback data to apply custom constraint. As enabled by SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(). Callback is called during the next Begin().

    


    

    
2192

    
    

    
// NB: For basic min/max size constraint on each axis you don't need to use the callback! The SetNextWindowSizeConstraints() parameters are enough.

    


    

    
2193

    
    

    
struct ImGuiSizeCallbackData

    


    

    
2194

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
2195

    
    

    
    void*   UserData;       // Read-only.   What user passed to SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(). Generally store an integer or float in here (need reinterpret_cast<>).

    


    

    
2196

    
    

    
    ImVec2  Pos;            // Read-only.   Window position, for reference.

    


    

    
2197

    
    

    
    ImVec2  CurrentSize;    // Read-only.   Current window size.

    


    

    
2198

    
    

    
    ImVec2  DesiredSize;    // Read-write.  Desired size, based on user's mouse position. Write to this field to restrain resizing.

    


    

    
2199

    
    

    
};

    


    

    
2200

    
    

    

    


    

    
2201

    
    

    
// [ALPHA] Rarely used / very advanced uses only. Use with SetNextWindowClass() and DockSpace() functions.

    


    

    
2202

    
    

    
// Important: the content of this class is still highly WIP and likely to change and be refactored

    


    

    
2203

    
    

    
// before we stabilize Docking features. Please be mindful if using this.

    


    

    
2204

    
    

    
// Provide hints:

    


    

    
2205

    
    

    
// - To the platform backend via altered viewport flags (enable/disable OS decoration, OS task bar icons, etc.)

    


    

    
2206

    
    

    
// - To the platform backend for OS level parent/child relationships of viewport.

    


    

    
2207

    
    

    
// - To the docking system for various options and filtering.

    


    

    
2208

    
    

    
struct ImGuiWindowClass

    


    

    
2209

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
2210

    
    

    
    ImGuiID             ClassId;                    // User data. 0 = Default class (unclassed). Windows of different classes cannot be docked with each others.

    


    

    
2211

    
    

    
    ImGuiID             ParentViewportId;           // Hint for the platform backend. -1: use default. 0: request platform backend to not parent the platform. != 0: request platform backend to create a parent<>child relationship between the platform windows. Not conforming backends are free to e.g. parent every viewport to the main viewport or not.

    


    

    
2212

    
    

    
    ImGuiViewportFlags  ViewportFlagsOverrideSet;   // Viewport flags to set when a window of this class owns a viewport. This allows you to enforce OS decoration or task bar icon, override the defaults on a per-window basis.

    


    

    
2213

    
    

    
    ImGuiViewportFlags  ViewportFlagsOverrideClear; // Viewport flags to clear when a window of this class owns a viewport. This allows you to enforce OS decoration or task bar icon, override the defaults on a per-window basis.

    


    

    
2214

    
    

    
    ImGuiTabItemFlags   TabItemFlagsOverrideSet;    // [EXPERIMENTAL] TabItem flags to set when a window of this class gets submitted into a dock node tab bar. May use with ImGuiTabItemFlags_Leading or ImGuiTabItemFlags_Trailing.

    


    

    
2215

    
    

    
    ImGuiDockNodeFlags  DockNodeFlagsOverrideSet;   // [EXPERIMENTAL] Dock node flags to set when a window of this class is hosted by a dock node (it doesn't have to be selected!)

    


    

    
2216

    
    

    
    bool                DockingAlwaysTabBar;        // Set to true to enforce single floating windows of this class always having their own docking node (equivalent of setting the global io.ConfigDockingAlwaysTabBar)

    


    

    
2217

    
    

    
    bool                DockingAllowUnclassed;      // Set to true to allow windows of this class to be docked/merged with an unclassed window. // FIXME-DOCK: Move to DockNodeFlags override?

    


    

    
2218

    
    

    

    


    

    
2219

    
    

    
    ImGuiWindowClass() { memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this)); ParentViewportId = (ImGuiID)-1; DockingAllowUnclassed = true; }

    


    

    
2220

    
    

    
};

    


    

    
2221

    
    

    

    


    

    
2222

    
    

    
// Data payload for Drag and Drop operations: AcceptDragDropPayload(), GetDragDropPayload()

    


    

    
2223

    
    

    
struct ImGuiPayload

    


    

    
2224

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
2225

    
    

    
    // Members

    


    

    
2226

    
    

    
    void*           Data;               // Data (copied and owned by dear imgui)

    


    

    
2227

    
    

    
    int             DataSize;           // Data size

    


    

    
2228

    
    

    

    


    

    
2229

    
    

    
    // [Internal]

    


    

    
2230

    
    

    
    ImGuiID         SourceId;           // Source item id

    


    

    
2231

    
    

    
    ImGuiID         SourceParentId;     // Source parent id (if available)

    


    

    
2232

    
    

    
    int             DataFrameCount;     // Data timestamp

    


    

    
2233

    
    

    
    char            DataType[32 + 1];   // Data type tag (short user-supplied string, 32 characters max)

    


    

    
2234

    
    

    
    bool            Preview;            // Set when AcceptDragDropPayload() was called and mouse has been hovering the target item (nb: handle overlapping drag targets)

    


    

    
2235

    
    

    
    bool            Delivery;           // Set when AcceptDragDropPayload() was called and mouse button is released over the target item.

    


    

    
2236

    
    

    

    


    

    
2237

    
    

    
    ImGuiPayload()  { Clear(); }

    


    

    
2238

    
    

    
    void Clear()    { SourceId = SourceParentId = 0; Data = NULL; DataSize = 0; memset(DataType, 0, sizeof(DataType)); DataFrameCount = -1; Preview = Delivery = false; }

    


    

    
2239

    
    

    
    bool IsDataType(const char* type) const { return DataFrameCount != -1 && strcmp(type, DataType) == 0; }

    


    

    
2240

    
    

    
    bool IsPreview() const                  { return Preview; }

    


    

    
2241

    
    

    
    bool IsDelivery() const                 { return Delivery; }

    


    

    
2242

    
    

    
};

    


    

    
2243

    
    

    

    


    

    
2244

    
    

    
// Sorting specification for one column of a table (sizeof == 12 bytes)

    


    

    
2245

    
    

    
struct ImGuiTableColumnSortSpecs

    


    

    
2246

    
    

    
{

    


    

    
2247

    
    

    
    ImGuiID                     ColumnUserID;       // User id of the column (if specified by a TableSetupColumn() call)

    


    

    
2248

    
    

    
    ImS16                       ColumnIndex;        // Index of the column

    


    

    
2249

    
    

    
    ImS16                       SortOrder;          // Index within parent ImGuiTableSortSpecs (always stored in order starting from 0, tables sorted on a single criteria will always have a 0 here)

    


    

    
2250

    
    

    
    ImGuiSortDirection          SortDirection : 8;  // ImGuiSortDirection_Ascending or ImGuiSortDirection_Descending (you can use this or SortSign, whichever is more convenient for your sort function)

    


    

    
2251

    
    

    

    


    

    
2252

    
    

    
    ImGuiTableColumnSortSpecs() { memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this)); }

    


    

    
2253

    
    

    
};

    


    

    
2254

    
    

    

    


    

    
2255

    
    

    
// Sorting specifications for a table (often handling sort specs for a single column, occasionally more)
